definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to join together/to lack/narrow and shallow

sentences.english: He gives you a thumbs up, slurps his coffee, and walks away.
sentences.chinese: 他對您表示讚許，並啜着咖啡滿意地走開了。

sentences.english: Hillsden took a sip of tea, but it was stone cold.
sentences.chinese: 希爾斯登啜了一口茶，但茶是冰冷的。

sentences.english: NO09, Jay paused for a sip of tea, and then went on with his story.
sentences.chinese: 傑伊停下來啜了一口茶，然後繼續講他的故事。

sentences.english: The caramel mix into the Latte, have a great taste. Gently sip, eyes closed.
sentences.chinese: 拿鐵里加入了焦糖，輕輕地啜一口，閉上眼。

sentences.english: It's no good letting a baby suck the nipple.
sentences.chinese: 讓嬰兒啜奶頭沒有好處。

sentences.english: He was alone, sipping tea, when she got there.
sentences.chinese: 此時他正獨自一人，端茶輕啜。

sentences.english: Papa wants us to be married,' he continued, after sipping some of the liquid.
sentences.chinese: “爸爸要我們結婚，”他啜了一點茶後，接着說。

definition: the corners of the mouth/the lips
dilettante/amateur/to dabble in/to flirt with (a topic)
to pour wine/to drink wine/to deliberate/to consider
